remarks: A pair ` <. G , F >. ` is in the domain of the arrow composition, if the domain of ` G ` equals the codomain of ` F ` .  (In this case we say ` G ` and ` F ` are composable.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Jan-2017.)
statement:
coafval.o $e |- .x. = ( compA ` C ) $.
coafval.a $e |- A = ( Arrow ` C ) $.
eldmcoa $p |- ( G dom .x. F <-> ( F e. A /\ G e. A /\ ( codA ` F ) = ( domA ` G ) ) ) $.
